Glacors (/ˈɡleɪsɔːr/ GLAY-soar) are fairly dangerous monsters, which were brought to Gielinor from another world, Leng.

Glacors can be found in both the Glacor Cave, the Glacor Front of the Elder God Wars Dungeon and the Wilderness, located in level 44-47 Wilderness. The glacors in the Wilderness are aggressive.

The glacors in the cave can only be fought after completion of the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest, with the fairy ring DKQ providing quick access to the cave. The glacors that are part of the Glacor Front do not require completion of the aforementioned quest. Unlocking them as a Slayer assignment from Kuradal, Morvran and Laniakea requires 50 Slayer points to get them as a task.

Glacors are the only creatures to drop the three glacyte boots, worth several million coins each. They are also the only source of shards of Armadyl, 100 of which can be used to craft an Orb of Armadyl, required to make an Armadyl battlestaff. Completion of Ritual of the Mahjarrat is required to receive shards of Armadyl. A Most Wanted card may be used to increase the chances of receiving unique drops from glacors.

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Main article: Glacor/Strategies

History and nature[edit | edit source]

Main article: Glacor (race)

The world where glacors originate from is unknown. They are capable of interplanetary travel and travel through space as icy comets; additionally, they are capable of surviving orbital re-entry. An army of glacors once invaded the planet Leng this way, which they then froze beneath a layer of ice miles thick. The glacors remained on Leng and have inhabited it ever since.[1][2] In addition to regular glacors, Arch-Glacors and Ur-Glacors, which are larger and more powerful versions, also exist.[3][4]

The Mahjarrat Lucien summoned several hundred glacors to reinforce him during the 18th Ritual of Rejuvenation, although only one made it to the battle as the remaining several hundred were defeated by Kuradal.[5] Several glacors remain in the cave below the ritual site.

In the Sixth Age, the Elder God, Wen, in search of an army to reclaim her egg, discovered the glacors still on Leng, which for unknown reasons had become affected by shadow anima. She teleported an Arch-Glacor and a large number of standard glacors to Senntisten to breach the cathedral where her egg was held hostage. They were either destroyed or eventually returned to Leng.[6]

Glacyte boots drop table[edit | edit source]

The player has a 1/128 chance of accessing this table. Every drop on this table then has equal chance of being accessed, making every individual drop 1/1280. In addition to the 7 specific drops displayed on the table below, the player also has a chance at receiving 1 random tree seed, 4 random noted herbs, or 2 random noted herbs, for a total of 10 possible drops.

Wilderness drop table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the Wilderness shared loot table, which is a tertiary drop. To access the table, it has to be killed inside the Wilderness.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but do increase the chance of doing so, as does doing higher-level content.

Money making guide[edit | edit source]

The following money making guide is available for Glacor:

MethodHourly profitSkillsOther requirements
Killing glacors17,097,993
  • 95 , recommended
  • 80 , recommended
  • 91 recommended
  • Most Wanted card (glacors) for an increased chance of rare drops
  • Opting out of PvP with Vala (optional, but recommended if going to the Wilderness)
  • Genocidal perk (recommended for 0.1–6.9% dmg bonus on task)
  • Blood reaver familiar (recommended heal-damage passive bypasses Glacor's 50% health shield)
  • Start at or visit the Glacor Cave for the Stone of Jas buff (highly recommended for 3–6% dmg bonus)

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 13 March 2023 (Update):
      • Moved the glacors from the deep Wilderness area to where the greater demon ash lords and berserkers used to roam with additional spawns.
    • update 1 August 2022 (Update):
      • Removed the ice warriors, ice giants and ice spiders from the area, replacing them with glacors, wyverns and acheron mammoths respectively.
    • patch 31 January 2022 (Update):
      • Fixed an issue with examine text of Glacors and Glacytes in the Glacor Front.
    • update 1 November 2021 (Update):
      • Increased the amount of anima the player gains from killing creatures within Senntisten.
      • Having the ring upgraded will now continue to drop anima at a 100% drop rate rather than the previous 1/6 chance.
    • patch 4 October 2021 (Update):
      • The various EAB abilities from the generals around the Elder God Wars Dungeon will now work against the Glacors.
      • Fixed an issue that allowed Glacors to be attacked through the boss encounter barrier at the Glacor Front.
    • update 31 August 2021 (Update):
      • Graphically updated.
    • patch 15 July 2019 (Update):
      • Glacytes no longer count towards a Glacors slayer task.
    • patch 11 March 2019 (Update):
      • Tuska's Wrath now deals additional damage on Glacors, Nihils and Muspahs when assigned them for a slayer task.
    • ninja 3 April 2018 (Update):
      • The Enduring Glacyte will now be aggressive to the player when they spawn when fighting Glacors.
    • patch 24 August 2015 (Update):
      • Glacors can no longer be lured into attacking their own kin.
    • patch 30 April 2013 (Update):
      • Glacors no longer become aggressive when a player targets them.
    • patch 28 January 2013 (Update):
      • Fire magic now does more damage against Glacors.
    • patch 22 November 2012 (Update):
      • The difficulty of combat with Glacors has been modified.
    • update 14 September 2011 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • Glacors' name likely comes from the word "glacier" for a large body of ice.
    • In the 2011 Halloween event, the player had to choose a glacor to represent Frank in statue form. Beauty described them as "a rare form of ice elemental".
    • The glacor fought during the quest can be killed and it will give usual drops.
    • There was a glitch that enabled you to be in combat with 2 glacors at once using Chain. Normally, the ability would ignore other glacors; however, it was able to hit multiple glacors if it was used to initiate combat. This has been fixed on 13 April 2015.
    • Prior to Legacy Mode, glacors had 30,000 life points.
    • The Promised Gift revealed the existence of Arch-Glacors, 100 times larger than regular ones on the plane of Leng.[4]
    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for this monster was 61,648 kills.[8]
      • This had not increased by 6 May 2018.[9]
    • The Evolution of Combat greatly reduced glacors' combat level while raising that of the glacytes, resulting in the glacytes having a higher combat level than glacors.

    References[edit | edit source]

    1. ^ "The Glacor Front", RuneScape. "Leng was one of the first planets created by the elder gods. It was no paradise, but it birthed an industrious civilisation whose name is now long forgotten. When the icy comets appeared in the sky, the people of Leng had no idea what awaited them. The crashing comets wrought devastation as they landed, but something worse rose out of the craters. The incorporeal invaders formed towering suits of armour from the ice they brought with them. That same ice spread across the whole world, covering the cities and freezing their people. Their work done, the glacors stood vigil over a silent, dead world for countless aeons."
    2. ^ The Journal of Fell Arnessen, written by Fell Arnessen, RuneScape. "This was no slow-moving glacier, but an eternal, frozen plain, miles deep. In places the snow was blasted away by the wind, and I could see the murky ice reach down into the depths below where the roots of the mountains lay... As I wandered, I saw shapes through the ice, on the bottom far below. They were too regular or too incredible to be natural rock. They were buildings, great cities even, buried in a frozen, sunken slumber."
    3. ^ The Journal of Fell Arnessen, written by Fell Arnessen, RuneScape. "Every Fremennik knows the legend of the glacor's, those savage beings of ice brought forth by unholy sorcerers. What appeared on the horizon was a glacor of truly titanic size."
    4. ^ a b The Promised Gift, written by Zaros, RuneScape. "Finally I created the stone of ice from an arch-glacor on the frozen world of Leng. These creatures, that tower ten or a hundred times taller than their smaller kin, dominate the landscape of that brutal and inhospitable wasteland."
    5. ^ Kuradal, RuneScape. "Player: What? You were there? I didn't see you.
      Kuradal: Nor I you, but I was there, fighting off Mahjarrat and their minions. None of them were Lucien, though. I chased one of them into a cave, full of ice elementals called glacors. After killing a couple hundred of those, I managed to escape, but by then it was all over: everyone had gone."
    6. ^ "The Glacor Front", RuneScape. "When the elder god Wen needed powerful servants, she found them waiting in this inhospitable place. Anathema suffused the planet and its denizens. Could she really unleash them against Gielinor - the hatchery for her precious egg? Unwilling to approach such tainted beings, she opened portals for them, and turned her face from the destruction to come."
    7. ^ a b c d e f g h i j k Mod Shauny. "Dev Blog: Revealing Drop Rates." 1 December 2017. (Archived from the original on 3 December 2017.) Existing Game Updates Forums.
    8. ^ Mod Shauny. Top 10 killers per Slayer Creature. Reddit. 2 February 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 February 2020.) Mod Shauny: "Here are the top 10 kills for each Slayer creature in RuneScape, be aware that we've not listed display names for privacy purposes however if you wish to brag about one number being yours then we won't stop you!"
    9. ^ Mod Shauny. Top Slayer Killers - 6th May 2018. Reddit. 6 May 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 February 2020.) Mod Shauny: "Here are the top 10 kills for each Slayer creature in RuneScape, be aware that we've not listed display names for privacy purposes however if you wish to brag about one number being yours then we won't stop you!"
